alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Elmore; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Autauga, southwestern Elmore and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 738 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Prattville to Maxwell Air Force Base. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Montgomery, Prattville, Millbrook, Coosada, Hunter, Maxwell Air Force Base, Montgomery Zoo, Boylston, Montgomery Riverwalk Stadium, Autauga County Airport and Alabama State Capitol. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
